DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to clarify the potential of intra-articular ultrasound imaging, non-invasive ultrasound imaging, quantitative MRI imaging, contrast-enhanced CT imaging and arthroscopy for diagnostics of knee osteoarthritis. All methods will be cross-correlated and compared with the arthroscopic findings.
DOC.brief_title: Clinical Study of Novel Diagnostic Techniques for Knee Osteoarthritis
DOC.criteria: KellgrenLawrence grade = 13 or cartilage defect detected in MRI Age >= 20 years Tumor or inflammation in the knee Severe general diseases Diabetes
